meanings.definition: The act of changing from one thing to another.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the player made a quick switching of strategies to surprise the opponent.
meanings.sent2: The switching of TV channels became a habit for him whenever commercials came on.
meanings.sent3: The switching of seats in class caused a funny mix-up with everyone ending up in the wrong place.
meanings.sent4: Her switching from a shy introvert to a confident speaker was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The constant switching between tasks made it hard for him to focus on one thing at a time.

meanings.definition: A device for making and breaking the connection in an electric circuit.
meanings.sent1: The technician carefully handled the switching to ensure the circuit remained stable.
meanings.sent2: The switching in the control room was done swiftly to prevent any power outages.
meanings.sent3: The switching in the electrical panel sparked a small but harmless fire.
meanings.sent4: The switching in the circuit breaker saved the house from a potential electrical disaster.
meanings.sent5: The clicking sound of the switching in the circuit was a reassuring sign of power flow.

meanings.definition: The act of shifting from one position or direction to another.
meanings.sent1: The sudden switching of the wind direction caught the sailors off guard.
meanings.sent2: The switching of gears in the car was smooth, thanks to the new transmission system.
meanings.sent3: The switching of roles in the play added an unexpected twist to the storyline.
meanings.sent4: Her switching from a follower to a leader was a significant change in the team dynamics.
meanings.sent5: The switching of lanes on the highway required careful observation and signaling.
